ref: 11759 vídhyati: vīndhe vījṇū ʻ to pierce ʼ (vīndho m. ʻ hole ʼ der. *vindhati); deriv. vej m. ʻ hole ʼ.
11759 vídhyati ʻ pierces, afflicts, drives away ʼ RV. [Meaning ʻ throw ʼ of S. and viddha -- ʻ thrown ʼ lex. also in Ir. P. Tedesco BSL 72, 116. -- √vyadh]
Pa. vijjhati ʻ pierces, shoots with an arrow ʼ, vijjhana<-> n.;

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart
ref: NiDoc. vijaṁti ʻ they wound ʼ, &gacute ʻ a wound ʼ;
S. vijhaṇu ʻ to throw down, put in, sheathe ʼ (pp. vidho < viddhá -- );
L.khet cā -- vijhan (cā<-> < cāpayati) ʻ to attach to, apply ʼ;
N. bijhnu ʻ to pierce (of a thorn) ʼ, bijhāunu ʻ to prick ʼ;
H. bījhnā ʻ to tear up earth with horns and hoofs (of a bull) ʼ;
Si. vidinavā ʻ to pierce, bore through, shoot ʼ, pp. vidi, caus. viddanavā.
